Package org.water.bluetooth.application.executor.connection

Class Connection

java.lang.Object
org.water.bluetooth.application.executor.connection.Connection
public class Connection extends Object
The Connection class provides methods for managing Bluetooth communication and checking the allowed devices based on the configuration file. It includes functionality to verify if a remote device is allowed for Bluetooth communication and to retrieve the current environment type.

Usage: 

 // Check if a remote device is allowed
 boolean isAllowed = Connection.allowed("RemoteDeviceName");

 // Retrieve the current environment type
 EnvironmentType currentEnvironment = Connection.getEnvironment();

The class uses the "config.properties" file located in the "src/main/resources" directory to store configuration properties such as allowed devices and the current environment.

Since:
2023-12-09
Version:
1.0
Author:
gubbriaco, agrandinetti, fnicoletti

  • Method Details

    • allowed

      public static boolean allowed(String remoteDeviceName) throws IOException
      Checks if the specified remote device is allowed for Bluetooth communication based on the list of permitted devices read from the configuration file.
      Parameters:
      remoteDeviceName - The name of the remote device to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if the remote device is allowed, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the configuration file.

    • getEnvironment

      public static EnvironmentType getEnvironment() throws IOException, NullPointerException
      Retrieves the current environment type based on the "ENVIRONMENT" property read from the configuration file.
      Returns:
      The EnvironmentType representing the current environment.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the configuration file.
      NullPointerException - If the "ENVIRONMENT" property is not found or has an invalid value.

    • toStringProperties

      public static String toStringProperties(String property) throws IOException
      Converts a specified property key to its corresponding value by reading the configuration from the "config.properties" file.
      Parameters:
      property - The key of the property whose value needs to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The value associated with the specified property key.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the configuration file.
